p: Humans today live in a global village; therefore, their health and socio-economic reality are becoming more and more interwoven. Most significantly their health is linked irrespective of distance. According to the risk society theory (Giddens 2003), modern life creates comfort which results in unintended and unforeseen consequences. COVID-19 bring this closer home, the global reach of air travel and trade created an unintended consequence of ease of spread of communicable disease. The problem of climate change similarly highlights this problem.
